bibl.title: Henry Carlton v. William Cochrane. Order granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle, King County, Wash. Terr.
In the matter of the application of Henry Carlton No. 5930 For a Writ of Habeas Corpus Order Granting Writ

This cause coming on to be heard upon the Petition of Henry Carlton for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the Court having read and filed the said Petition, and it appearing to the Court therefrom that the said Henry Carlton is illegaly imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane, sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, in the common Jail of said County in the City of Seattle, and it appearing from the said petition that a Writ ought to issue, and it is considered and ordered by the Court that the Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of this Court, directed to the said Sheriff, commanding him to have the body of the said Henry Carlton before me, in the Court room of the said Court, on this 27th day of April, 1888, at 2 o'clock P.M. to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Henry Carlton: together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he then and there have the said writ.
Dated at Seattle, on the 27th day of Apr 1888
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding terms at _____
In the matter of the application of Henry Carlton for Habeas Corpus
